description: Tree surgery to all trees as specified in each of the following areas:Lawn areas: Lift to 2.5m and balance crown where required.Animal exhibits: Lift to 2.5m and balance crown where required.Open top animal exhibits: Prune branches that might facilitate animal escape where required.Meerkat Exhibit: Regular formative pruning of 3 x Tamarix gallica to character and habit within the available space and meet animal welfare requirements.Display Lawn: Prune back from ropes, perches and other installations by up to 1m. Maintain flight paths for display animals through sensitive pruning.Buildings: Prune clear of buildings by up to 2.0m and balance crown where required.OPM: Crown lift Quercus spp. to 3 metres above ground level as required to control risk of contact with OPM nests.Fruit trees and olive trees: Annual formative pruning.Vegetation overhanging perimeter fenceline from The Regent's Park: Prune back to fenceline as required.
